paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Leu12Pro, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: Oculoleptomeningeal amyloidosis with neurological decline, weight loss, confusion, fatigue, urinary and erectile dysfunction, slurred speech, right-sided weakness, hearing difficulties, and painless paraesthesia.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Rapidly progressive neurological decline with symptoms including weight loss, confusion, fatigue, erectile dysfunction, urinary urgency, slurred speech, right-sided weakness, hearing difficulties, and painless paraesthesia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 43-year-old right-handed Nigerian man was referred to our centre with rapidly progressive neurological decline.

functional_data.summary: The Leu12Pro mutation is associated with oculoleptomeningeal amyloidosis, but specific functional assays were not detailed in the paper.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on clinical presentation and mutation association.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first reported case of the TTR Leu12Pro variant in an African patient.
key_quotes: He was heterozygous for the leucine 12 proline mutation.
TTR amyloidosis is a rare cause of leptomeningeal enhancement, but should be considered if there is evidence of peripheral or autonomic neuropathy with cardiac or ocular involvement.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
